intro: Leucospermum glaberrimum, commonly known as the smooth firecracker, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are smooth and glabrous. Its inflorescences consist of dense clusters of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Leucospermum glaberrimum is well-suited to well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
